p: Future simulations reveled a range shift accompanied by range contraction phenomena in both the native and invaded regions. For the native region, of the 1,668 cells occupied at the present time, only 759 and 452 should remain occupied in 2050 and 2080, respectively ( Table 2). In the invaded regions, the number of occupied cells at the present time (999) falls to 551 and 397 in 2050 and 2080, respectively, evidencing a marked reduction of the invasive potential of C. macropomum in South American river basins in the face of climate change. When fish farming data is considered, the losses are a little milder, with 576 cells and 414 cells remaining occupied in 2050 and 2080, respectively.
